column4: ello! i have troubles getting amarok to work in ubuntu feisty (x86), flac is not supported while, when i load an mp3 file it just hangs
in short: i can't play back any mp3 or flac or wav file in amarok!
can you play them in other applications?
yes! amarok says there are no flac codecs. as for mp3, it pops up a message which asks me to install mp3 codecs and before i am able to click "yes" the application hangs
right, that isn't good. is your system updated?
i don't know what to suggest here other than trying to install support for these codecs manually. look at the RestrictedFormats section of the help wiki
i have the restricted package installed :(
i don't know what to suggest. can you try to play an mp3 on the commandline with 'play file.mp3'?
this is unfortunately an amarok related problem, mp3 and flac are playing without a hitch in any other app
right. perhaps there's an amarok channel?
that's a pity because i tried kubuntu and amarok is working great. the thing is i dont like kubuntu (or KDE in general)
i don't use amarok so can't help there sorry. good luck. it sounds to me like amarok expects a kde related sound service to exist that doesn't, or is being overridden by another..
thanks for the link. I am investigating... :)
it was way too simple. it worked! woohoo mp3 AND flac!
thanks a lot for the link.
